file_content.text: I'm not going back to the Exchange. I'm going freelance. Come with.
Paarkos has a separate purpose.
Don't bother with the alien. Stick by my side, I'll treat you right.
Don't bother with the alien. Stick by Ohta and me, we'll treat you right.
No thanks.
Hey, lifers. Guess who's not dead?
We recommend traveling. Expose yourselves to the unfamiliar.
Planning ahead already?
If you're making plans, you're never too old for higher education. I can recommend some institutes, if you'd like.
Their deaths will be perfunctory, albeit understandable. Finish here quickly.
Is that...?
Caution.
Careful, darling.
You made it out. Obviously, I mean. How, um, how did it go?
That's not your concern.
Ain't this something? Pulled off the plan even big brother couldn't manage. How'd it go down there?
Cleaned out the place. No one'll be using the Megasecurity Ward for a while.
I found what I needed.
You did perfect. I've never worked with a better crew.
The plan was fantastic.
Good. That's... good. Guess you're all set now.
That's real nice. Real proud of you, but:
This is for trying something stupid.
You turned on me. [Hit him]
Bold, but stupid.
Ah... suppose I deserved that. Don't change the facts.
That's not your concern.
I got in, I got out and I survived. Any more stupid questions?
It wasn't stupid.
Hey--we did a lot for you, you know. Just because Kanjon's dead, doesn't mean you don't owe us.
Hey--we did a lot for you, you know. Just because Kanjon's gone, doesn't mean you don't owe us.
Think there's just one.
Our plan got you through hell and back. Now it's time we got our share.
Head to the closest Imperial outpost. Tell them that Cipher Nine authorized your payment and safe transport off Belsavis.
The Empire will reward you.
Wait--what?
Your payment is accepted. Perhaps we will meet again.
This ain't some kind of trick...?
It is acceptable.
All right. Something's going on with you, but we all got secrets. The freak says the pay is good, I'll go with that.
You cheat, we come back. You line up another job... you give us a call.
I got you out of your cells; I don't owe you anything else. You can go now.
You're free to leave.
That's it...?
It is best to leave now.
Paarkos will remember your face.
Already, your decisions begin to expose you. Our partnership will not be a lengthy one.
Oh, we ain't going anywhere. For starters, we're going to slit you open like a calf and take your earnings from the Megasecurity Ward.
I worked hard for you.
Finally.
Paarkos does not agree, but will follow the group's consensus.
Either way, you're still dead.
Here's what I owe you.
Idiots. [Attack]
You're dead, you son of a sow!
Good to be handling tech again...
It's Chaney. Got a signal from the droids. My override's working, but, uh....
...there's an auto-maintenance facility. Soon as the droids report in to charge and repair, my overrides'll be wiped. Place needs trashing.
Send me coordinates.
On my way.
You're the tech expert. Disable it remotely.
Can you slice its systems?
Can't. Main systems are hardwired into old alien tech. Physical trauma's better.
The only reason I freed you was to handle this sort of thing. There shouldn't be any surprises.
You were unprepared.
I haven't touched a computer in fifteen years, okay? I'm doing fine. Now don't kill me.
The defenses are pretty thick. Facility might even be building new wardens--but wreck the core machine and it's down.
Don't look at me. I'm working.
Hey, boss? It's us. We got everything from the lab.
Paarkos found us a safe place where we can figure out our next step. Sending coordinates. Meet you there.
What? What?
The droids are going crazy! Paarkos is hurt, we're alone... I got to disconnect.
The droids are going crazy, but Kanjon and Paarkos are holding them off. I'll see if I can help you out.
This one was never a prisoner. Paarkos knew when she freed us; it did not matter, so Paarkos did not speak.
This one was never a prisoner. Paarkos knew when he freed us; it did not matter, so Paarkos did not speak.
